item.title: Donkey Kong Bananza Gets An Eight-Minute Overview Trailer
item.content:encoded:
DK...Donkey Kong!

We're now just weeks out from the smashing arrival of Donkey Kong Bananza on the Switch 2 and Nintendo has now released a overview trailer.

It uploaded plenty of these in the leadup to key releases during the Switch generation and this trend continues with eight minutes of footage for the new Switch 2 exclusive. It highlights DK and Pauline's abilities, transformations, boss battles, and much more.

Just keep in mind this overview is only available on Nintendo's Japanese YouTube channel at the moment but if we get an English version, we'll let you know.

Earlier this week we also shared our final preview of Donkey Kong Bananza here on Nintendo Life, and despite some minor technical concerns, his latest adventure is showing all the signs of becoming his greatest outing to date. The game's developer has been confirmed as well.

Are you looking forward to Donkey Kong Bananza? Notice anything in this latest trailer? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: Digimon Story: Time Stranger Switch 2 Listing Surfaces Online
item.content:encoded:
Fingers crossed

Bandai Namco ended its latest showcase with another look at Digimon Story: Time Stranger. If you were wondering about the possibility of a Nintendo release, there's reportedly been a new development.

As highlighted by multiple sources, a new listing has popped up on the EAN database in Europe which includes a code for an apparent "Switch 2 version". These codes are used by retailers to identify products at sale.

Nothing has been officially announced, so it's probably best to treat this one as a rumour for now. In saying this, Bandai Namco has already got games like Shadow Labyrinth coming to the Switch 2, so it wouldn't be the biggest surprise.

The Switch generation also saw multiple Digimon games released physically and digitally. Digimon Story: Time Stranger is currently confirmed for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S and Steam, and will launch on these platforms in October.

Would you be interested in this game on the Switch 2? Let us know in the comments.

[source nintendoeverything.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: Round Up: Bandai Namco Summer Showcase 2025 - Every Switch Game
item.content:encoded:
Bandai Namco held a summer showcase this week and it featured trailers for multiple upcoming Switch titles.

As all of these titles have already been announced for the Switch, what we've got here is some new footage and even some release dates for select titles. Along with this, we've also included the announcements and release dates for other platforms.

So, here's the full rundown featuring Pac-Man, Dragon Ball, and various other series under Bandai Namco:

Nintendo Switch Announcements

Patapon 1+2 Replay - July 11, 2025 (Nintendo Switch)

TOWA and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree - September 19, 2025 Nintendo Switch)

Shadow Labyrinth - July 18, 2025 (Nintendo Switch)

Little Nightmares III - October 10, 2025 (Nintendo Switch)

Everybody's Golf Hot Shots - September 5, 2025 (Nintendo Switch)

Super Robot Wars Y - August 28, 2025 (Nintendo Switch)

Dragon Ball Kakarot - Dragon Ball Daimi DLC - July 17, 2025 (Nintendo Switch)

And now that we're done with the Switch announcements, here's what else was revealed for other platforms. A Switch 2 listing has also been spotted for the new Digimon game, but this should be treated as a rumour for now.

Other Announcements

My Hero Academia - All's Justice - TBA

Code Vein II - 2026

Death Note Killer Within - Who Do You Trust? - Summer 2025

The Blood of Dawnwalker - 2026

Tekken 8 - New DLC Fighter Fahkumram - July 10, 2025

Digimon Story - October 3, 2025

What games from Bandai Namco's latest showcase are you excited about? Let us know in the comments.



https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/07/round-up-bandai-namco-summer-showcase-2025-every-switch-game
